Reviews.Title: “It'll do in a pinch.”
Reviews.Author: azkellyk
Reviews.Content: I usually get a deal in advance. This stay I just showed up and this is what I found. The woman at the front desk was great. The parking is free but they charge for wifi and there isn't a breakfast. It was pretty loud on the weekend so I didn't get great sleep. Overall nothing to write home about, but it was the only thing around for the price point.

Reviews.Title: “Smelly and hard bed”
Reviews.Author: Epidemic
Reviews.Content: This was the worst place my wife and I have ever stayed. We were passing through SD for the night and decided to stay here because it was right off the highway. The room was musty and the bed was hard as a rock. I have stayed at Motel 6 in other cities before, but this place does not measure up to their other hotels or other budget hotels. Pay some extra money for somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away ...”
Reviews.Author: athlux
Reviews.Content: One of the worst Motel 6 I stayed in a long time. Avoid the tower. We got a room near the elevator and there was constant noise throughout the night. You could also see the bright light from the hallway trough the door so that it was never completely dark in the room. The bed was uncomfortable and the pillows were the thinnest I had ever seen. Also the room had only one bar of soap and no shampoo. Luckily we stayed there only one night and avoided the bedbugs and hookers mentioned in the other reviews. Please do yourself a favor and stay away.

Reviews.Title: “I don't know what you guys are talking about”
Reviews.Author: paublina
Reviews.Content: Seriously, everyone in here is bashing this Motel 6 when I've been here literally almost every single month for the past 2 years with no incident. I have never, however, gotten the tower, it's always the main building where the office is located. I stay 1-2 nights before having to drop off my boyfriend at the airport (reason why we're there every month). We have never experienced bedbugs, or anything horrible at all. We stay, sleep and feel refreshed the very next day, it definitely is a bummer when they don't have rooms, because we stay there so much that rooms have gone down to about 40 bucks a night. This is recommended for any type of stay, long or short. I actually try to stay at Motel 6 at other places I go. One thing they do not have however, is a hair dryer, so make sure that you bring your own hair dryer.

Reviews.Title: “A Bed and a Bath but Nothing "Beyond"”
Reviews.Author: Maxine013
Reviews.Content: You get what you pay for. I searched the internet for several weeks trying to find a "safe" economical motel close to SeaWorld in San Diego. Everything was a little high for me, around a $100 a night. ( I'm retired, but still working), So I pulled out my Motel 6 book, and found a deal to beat all the others, $210, total, for three nights, and that included a Micro/Fridge for just an additional $3 a day. The staff were very accommodating; answered all my questions, and were very professional. Having stayed @ a refurbished Motel 6, three times in the last year, in San Antonio, Texas, I expected similar accommodatons in San Diego. The San Diego Motel 6, is on the "to be refurbished list" and it is due. The place is just well worn, dirty carpets, etc. I also got the impression that "people live there too" ( due to the hard economic times in California). I think this brings down the standard of any Motel. We were in room #171; don't stay there. It is above the parking garage, down the very end of the hall, above the laundry room, and adjacent to the elevator, that goes up and down 24 hours a day. Also, the hall is an enterior hallway in the four story "tower" building, and there were lots of dogs and "poop" and "pee" circles around. I saw a small dog "poop" by the vending machine outside, and 24 hours later, it was still there. But like I stated, you get what you pay for, & I got a comfortable bed, and a good bathroom to use and morning coffee each morning in the office. Take your blowdryer, and shampoo, you just get linens @ Motel 6 now. We were out all day seeing the sights, and I slept through the night despite the noise, door slamming, constant pizza delivery, elevator, and laundry room noise. I felt fortunate to have enough money to take a long weekend trip to a fun place like San Diego. I felt even more fortunate, when I went to Ralph's grocery early Sunday morning, and viewed a "senior" like myself digging plactic bottles from the trash. It is all how you look at things.

Reviews.Title: “The Worst Motel 6 In America”
Reviews.Author: TrooperRat
Reviews.Content: Let me preface this by saying I have stayed at a LOT of Motel 6's around the country. The value is good, the rooms are clean and I go on vacations for the things whatever place I am going to provide, not to stay in a room. I just want a good night's sleep in the room. So, my son and I went on our first ever ocean fishing trip. Sport water fishing they call it. We bought the tickets in advance for the boat, tackle and all of that and then booked a room at this hotel. When we arrived, I was surprised to find 2 buildings on this property. The first is the normal 2 story structure, the second is a HUGE 4-story structure behind it. We got into the room. It was very clean, I'll give them that, but that's where it ends. It was a very odd place. There were 3, small wall fixtures for lighting in the room, which was room 258. The lighting was very low and I didn't like that aspect of it at all. There was no alarm clock, something that really took me by surprise, every other Motel 6 I have been in at least had an alarm clock! No mini fridge and no microwave. Very few channels on the TV as well, though that wasn't really a bother, just throwing it in there. No lamps. Again, very odd. I can't remember any motel or hotel I have ever been in that didn't have a table lamp somewhere in it. But that is far from the worst of it. The noise. ALL night long. Doors slamming. People making loud noises walking up and down the hall - ALL night long. I have never experienced this much noise in any motel or hotel, much less a Motel 6 of which I have been on countless of their properties all over America. However many people were in the room above us? Walking back and forth, all night long. I did not get a single hour's worth of sleep in this room. We got up at 4:15 am, my head was aching. It ruined the trip. We are from Phoenix and had driven into town for the sole purpose of sea fishing. I had to take naps all day long, I was exhausted and basically I felt like I had thrown my money away on this trip because of the lack of sleep the night before. Well, I had paid for 2 nights. I figured after being on the ocean all day long, I would want to sleep a night and then drive home. When we got back from the ocean, I went into the office and demanded my money back, that or a different room with a GUARANTEE that it would be a quiet room. Let me add here that I take a box fan and ear plugs with me on any trip to make sure I will get a good night's sleep. Even with all of that, the noise emanating from above, the hallway and the doors slamming FAR overwhelmed the "white" noise of my box fan. We were moved to room 410 - the 4th floor and top floor of this building. I was so exhausted that I wanted to give it a try rather than having to go to another hotel and get another room - though there are PLENTY of hotels in that immediate area. We went to bed at around 10pm. At the same time I had turned the light out to go to bed, someone came into the room next to us and they were making a LOT of noise in there. Fortunately, it only lasted 15 minutes and then we slept - 10 hours straight in fact. But, the second night's sleep was irrelevant. It was the FIRST night's sleep that was crucially important and that was stripped of us from a hotel that doesn't seem to care about it's customer satisfaction level. This is not a typical Motel 6 in any way shape or form. PERHAPS it is a normal type of Motel 6 in the front, 2 story structure that people are used to seeing, but that 4 story thing is an animal. I am guessing from the reviews I have now read around the net about this particular facility that management undoubtedly knows about the noise levels in that bigger building and does nothing about it and certainly, you aren't warned about the noise in advance. If you can sleep with the equivalent sound of a jetliner taking off, then this place is all for you! If not, STEER CLEAR!!! One last thing, room 258 and room 410 were identical inside the room. The lighting, the lack of an alarm clock, everything, I assume the entire building identical as well.

Reviews.Title: “BEDBUGS!”
Reviews.Author: SAS95677
Reviews.Content: This hotel has BEDBUGS! They were reported in June 2010, and this hotel still has an ongoing problem, one year since the last positive report. Do a website search on bedbugs and this hotel and you will find the 2010 report. I stayed at this hotel from June 17-20, 2011. On the last day of my stay I found a small bedbug on the sheets. I am a biologist by training and profession, so I knew what it was, and flipped the beds to look for more. I found 3 small bedbugs total. I collected 2 of them in a cup and killed one. I took them to the hotel desk and presented them to the manager. He was not interested in seeing them, and surprisingly none of the staff members blinked an eye when they heard the word bedbug (I think they are all well aware they have an ongoing problem). Since he wasn't interested in seeing them in the cup, I dumped them out of the cup onto the counter. He still wasn't interested in seeing them. I asked for a refund, and proof that they were working on fixing the problem. The manager said their procedure was to have an exterminator look at the room and if they found bedbugs they would see about giving me a refund. I put the bedbugs back into the cup and told him to show them to the exterminator. He called later in the afternoon and said the exterminator came and couldn't find anything. I am not surprised by this because I took the room apart and only found 3 (which I collected or killed). However, he said the insects I found were roaches, and not bedbugs! I was a graduate student studying ecology/zoology, and have taken a graduate level entomology course. I have seen bedbugs in entomology class, and have seen plenty of roaches. There is a clear shape difference between roaches and bedbugs, and although the bedbugs I found were small, I confirmed what they were with a hand lens I had in my car. So, the hotel management denies it has a bedbug problem, and the infestation continues. Additionally when I flipped the beds I realized they were the nastiest beds I have ever seen at a hotel, stained, crumbs, small curly hairs, and falling apart. The risk of bringing bedbugs to your home is definitely not worth staying here!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely gross. SAVE. YOUR. MONEY.”
Reviews.Author: cali-girl89113
Reviews.Content: This was hands down one of the nastiest hotels I have ever stayed in. I was not in control of the booking of this unfortunately since my friend asked me to go to San Diego at the last minute and she had already booked this place. I absolutely agree with the other terrible reviews - it unfortunately lived up to them. About the only thing I didn't experience was the hookers and bedbugs (thank goodness!). When we checked in, there were some very sketchy looking characters doing laundry in the "tower" where our room was. Then we got to the elevator (a death trap) and headed up to our floor. The smell in the hallway was disgusting, somewhere between mold and feet. The room wasn't overtly filthy, although some of the smell of the hallway had definitely seeped in. The pillows were seriously the FLATTEST things I have ever seen and the bed was akin to something they give mis-behaving prisoners to sleep on. It may as well have been a board or a concrete bench. So uncomfortable. The boxspring had some lovely stains on it... didn't even want to know what that was. The carpet was filthy... neither myself or my friend walked around barefoot the whole time. The thing that killed me was that they were charging almost ONE HUNDRED dollars a night to those that didn't have reservations... we paid around $73, which was still unbelievably high for the quality of hotel we got. I would have been upset paying even $20 for this craphole. Please, if you're thinking of booking here and, like me, are trying to convince yourself that the reviews were just written by impossibly picky people, PLEASE run away and pay the extra $30 or $40 a night to be somewhere that doesn't make your skin crawl. I will NEVER stay in a Motel 6 again.

Reviews.Title: “Bed bugs!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Cherrylipz21
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the most nasty hotel I have ever stay at! I should have left as soon as I walked into my room. The place was very run down and was way over priced. The next day when I woke up, my bed was infested with bed bugs and when I talked to a manager he tried to pretend like he didn't even know what bed bugs looked like. So I caught one in a cup and show him, still he acted like he didn't know .

Reviews.Title: “Taking BUDGET to the extreme”
Reviews.Author: spycygrl
Reviews.Content: Seriously...the ONLY reason to stay here is the location. We booked a 1Q room online for $85.99/nt (I'm assuming the rates were slightly higher than usual due to the Tiki Oasis event next door). Note that when you book a "1 bed" room, you still just get a Queen bed (instead of a King) AND it's the exact same price as a room with TWO QUEENS! I really wish I would have known this, since I'm sure the 2Q room is larger. ALSO, all of the single bed rooms are in the OLD 2-story motel building near the freeway. The "Tower" (a 4-story newer building) houses all of the double rooms. I'm not sure what the rooms in the Tower are like, but our room was pretty icky for $86/nt. The moment we opened the front door, we were BOWLED over by the smell of mildew. It seriously smelled like damp socks in our room. The cleaning staff had not opened any windows prior to our arrival and had left the A/C unit on "warmer" temp (it was about 85 degrees, that day, outside). We immediately had to open the window and turn the A/C on full-blast to help air out the room. Unfortunately, the curtains open from the OPPOSITE side from the open window, so you can't even really get good ventilation without somehow propping open the curtains with something. There are no windows in the bathroom, so any time someone took a shower, we had to leave the door open or it became a stinky, mildewy sauna in there. There is a small ventilation "fan" in the wall which is on the same switch as the light, so we ended up having to leave the bathroom light on all day after taking a shower in order to keep the room from being sweaty and smelly. There was mold around the base of the tub and along the interior. There was also no lid on the toilet ("open seat") and the only towel bar was directly over it. You ran the risk of your towel falling into the open toilet, if you hung it there. There are NO amenities AT ALL in the room. I stayed in another chain's "budget" motel, recently, and they still provided shampoo and a coffeemaker. You get none of that, here. You are provided two very tiny bars of soap (total old school soap wafers with the M6 logo embossed on them) which barely last 2 days. The towels are clean and not thread-bare (at least), but are still very thin and small. No hair dryer or Kleenex. A friend of ours didn't even get an ice bucket (we did). There aren't even "Do Not Disturb" signs for the door! I had to make my own with a business card and a sharpie. I also can't believe they want to CHARGE you to use the Wi-Fi. The least they could do is give you that for free (it's $2.99 for 24hrs). The bed is hard, the sheets are rough and the pillows are flat. The thin, scratchy polyester blanket on our bed had several large burn holes in it. At least there were no bed bugs. I can't be grateful for that. As someone else mentioned, the parking spaces seem to all be for compacts and people end up boxing you in. There is also no monitoring of the parking lot and on Friday nite, when we came back from eating, we had a hard time finding a space (I know all of those cars were NOT guest vehicles). Here are the ONLY PROS: The A/C actually worked pretty well. It was right next door to Crowne Plaza and there was even a little "secret pathway" through the trees, so you didn't have to walk out on the street. We faced the parking lot (instead of the freeway) and our room was pretty quiet. The pool was very clean and some umbrellas were provided -- we even watched the woman clean it (note that it is NOT heated, however). If you are going to an event at the Crowne Plaza and don't want to pay CP prices, this location can't be beat. That said, it's nearly the only thing this motel has going for it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: Brian0454
Reviews.Content: We just spent 8 nights at this motel and it was an excellent choice. I had some fears prior to arriving at the motel regarding noise factor, comfort of the beds, cleanliness, etc., however, I was pleasantly surprised. We stayed on the 4th floor of the "Tower", which is a 4 story complex located behind the main building, and it was very quiet, clean, and comfortable. We had an excellent view to the west, and was able to see the nightly fireworks from Sea World. I would recommend this Motel 6 to my friends and advise them to request staying on the 4th floor of the "Tower." In addition, we had excellent customer service from the management at this motel regarding our reservation. Without going into detail, they were very accomodating in ensuring our stay was enjoyable, and I thank them for going out of their way in assisting us. With all of the negative comments left on this website, I thought it was appropriate to leave a positive one. Another excellent amenity was the close proximity to I-8 and our ability to get to the beaches and Sea World within minutes. Total thumbs up!

Reviews.Title: “Stay here if you must, but there must be something nicer for $55.”
Reviews.Author: 4globaliridescence
Reviews.Content: Pros: Clean sheets. Warm shower water. TV and air conditioning. They had a laundry room if you needed it. Complimentary bar of soap for face and body (but that was it). Westfield mall with relatively good fast food (Chipotle, Pei-Wei) and a movie theatre was a 5 minute drive out. Cons: $3.00 for internet access for only one computer that lasts 24 hours. Musty/Moldy/Feet-like smell immediately hits you when you walk in to the room. Bring your own shampoo because they do not provide it. Instead they point you to a vending machine of toiletries. Box-spring cover had some mysterious white stain on it, but I did not investigate further. Tight parking spaces and don't park near the tree next to the "high-rise" building because your car will have water spots the next day. Dangerous exiting maneuvers required to get to hotel from the freeway, especially during rush hour (as we found out)! Room 200 was difficult to find because it was illogically placed between 249 and 230-something. It was in a building marked with every room number except 200 (yet two people pointed to it) and the room does NOT exist on the "in case of fire" printed maps located on the walls. Families stayed there and we could hear children play-screaming in the hall. Randoms: Witnessed a hotel guest use their garbage can to collect ice from the ice machine. I have no idea why anyone would think this is a good idea, even if you just wanted to cool drinks, the garbage can bacteria would be transferred to anything the ice touched!! Horrible orange-colored paint trim, which just makes it look cheap when it doesn't need to be. They have a permanently-affixed microwave in a common area, which I was afraid to look in, but did see one guest use it and incidentally, that common area also had a musty smell even though it was pretty well-ventilated.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: bravo1950
Reviews.Content: A very large motel 6 with extremely small rooms that are very expensive. Not very clean and smells of mould. an Ok stay for 1 night but you can get a much better value on Hotel Circle than this place.

Reviews.Title: “Cali Trip Summer 2009”
Reviews.Author: sinhowang
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a week vacation trip from California. The weather in San Diego was nice the whole time we were there, always stayed cool during the daytime and not too cold during the night time. We stayed at the Motel 6 on Hotel Circle, which was a good location to put all the hotels because it was really close to the main freeway. We decided to go to the Gaslamp Quarter area to get something to eat for dinner. I would definitely recommend the Gaslamp Quarter, as there is a ton of selection of restaurants and bars which are open late. So whatever you might be craving, the Gaslamp Quarter should fulfill your needs. The next day we visited the Cabrillo National Monument, which is a lighthouse on top of a peninsula, the peninsula was elevated above San Diego which provided a great view of the ocean and the air force base to the side. The lighthouse itself was fairly small, but there was still a lot of things to see and learn from it. We then visited the Air & Space Museum and the USS Midway Museum after eating lunch at a small restaurant. Both Museums were both worth it, they were huge and there was a lot to see. The Air & Space Museum had a large selection of aircraft and it had a very fun simulator which takes you on a roller coaster ride. The USS Midway Museum, is basically a large aircraft carrier, which you get to board and you get an audio tour of the whole ship at your own pace. You get to visit most of the sections of the ship including the flight deck and the control tower, it was fun for the entire family. For the last day in San Diego, we visited the Birch Aquarium and Balboa Park. The Birch Aquarium was a lot smaller than I anticipated, and there wasn't a large selection of aquatic animals. Balboa Park on the other hand was large and it had a lot of attractions to see and do. I would recommend giving at least an entire day for Balboa Park, there is just too much to see and do that we felt rushed to get it done with only half a day.

Reviews.Title: “Even bad for a Motel 6 . . .”
Reviews.Author: HoyaSaxa619
Reviews.Content: Wife planned a night away from the kids on short notice, and on a very tight budget (like most people these days). She doesn't travel often (like I have to do for work), and thus she really wouldn't know a Motel 6 from a Comfort Inn from a Radisson (well, at least not until our recent stay). So she dropped the kids off at the grandparents, and booked us a rooom at this Motel 6 on the Internet, as it was close to somewhere we wanted to go for breakfast the next morning. She won't make the same mistake (i.e., booking at this, or any, Motel 6) twice. We check in around 6pm or so, I think, before we head out for dinner in nearby Old Town. She walks to the room (112), and I pull the car around back to the parking lot--only to be solicited by a hooker walking the property. (Uh, no thanks.) Besides the hooker, there were several other "interesting" characters loitering in the parking lot. I was sure to take my laptop, iPod, and anything else of value into the room, rather than leaving it in my car. In the room, the carpet underneath, and in front of, the sink area is SOAKED. Not damp, but absolutely saturated, as if someone left a hose running on it. Of course, I just HAD to find that out by stepping in it while wearing socks, and wondering why my socks were increasingly taking on water. Disgusting and unsanitary. (And when I had checked in, the front desk person told the guy behind me that they were totally booked/sold out, and turned him away. So no chance of getting a different room.) When my wife and I are leaving for dinner, the minute we walk out of our room, what do we see? The same hooker soliciting some construction workers (who were staying upstairs) right outside our door. I neither know nor care whether she had more success with them. When we get back, my wife showers. And, after she dries off, what does she come to find out --- THE FREAKIN TOWEL WAS FILTHY DIRTY, and must have been hung back up before we came in (or just wasn't checked by the staff). And I mean dirty. There was visible, black dirt on the white towel (it just happened to be on the side facing the wall, so my poor wife didn't get to see it until AFTER she had dried off). Freakin disgusting! (And, knowing that I would blow up and want to immediately check out, she didn't tell/show me till the next morning, as she didn't want our one night away from the kids to be completely ruined.) Lastly, when I go out later that night to get ice, there was ANOTHER PROSTITUTE prostitute patrolling the parking lot. (Don't people have Craigslist for that stuff now?) This was unreal, and VERY seedy. It was as if the hotel was hosting a "ladies of the night" convention. So, be warned. If you're looking to hook up with a streetwalker in dirty motel room, then (based on my one experience) you may want to check out this Motel 6. Otherwise, spend the extra $30 or so for a more enjoyable stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great value at $50, very satisfied”
Reviews.Author: junglecat64
Reviews.Content: The only explanation I can find for the previous negative reviews are that the motel has been refurbished and they rated it before that happened,. Or possibly that the reviewers are confused, or they are malicious idiots. One reviewer said "good for the price" and then gave them a 3-star rating?!? Yes, it has to be cleam, no matter what you pay, but beyond that you HAVE to take price into consideration when you rate. I literally moved out of 3 nights in a $475 executive suite at the Catamaran on Mission Bay into this Motel 6. I loved the Catamaran, but I cannot expect to get the same at the Motel 6 for $50. I stayed in the motel room closest to the office, right by the pool. It was clean, looked like it had been recently renovated. I slept well (because I always use earplugs), so I guess the bed was OK. The shower was fine, the carpet was fine, internet access at 3 bucks a day worked fine. And then you have a pool and free coffee in the morning. That is great value if you ask me. I'll be curious to see what future reviewers have to say, because I will likely use this motel again and again. I also note that Tripadvisor under 'describe this hotel's style" does not have a checkbox for "value". This is the best Motel 6 I have every stayed in. I live in Florida, and there are tons of bad Motel ^'s south of the Mason-Dixon line.

Reviews.Title: “Not a nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: LuckyMermaid
Reviews.Content: I didn't find this place scary, but it was very downtrodden. The shower smelt of mould, there were interesting stains, the traffic noise from the nearby road was louder than the aircon and the staff were very unhelpful; one guy was told he had to take a cab to the nearest cigarette seller in Old Town, when there is a Crowne Plaza next door that sells them. There are also notices in every room telling you to lock your door from the inside at night in case of intruders, which probably didn't help the nervous types. Once you find your way to the Crowne Plaza you can at least have breakfast, even if you don't smoke. Old Town is not too far away. But I wouldn't stay in this place again.

Reviews.Title: “The whole 4th floor smelled like marijuana”
Reviews.Author: pasadenapundit
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over Memorial Day weekend. Had a non-smoking room and the room still smelled like smoke. The hallway smelled like marijuana all night. I complained to the front desk and they did nothing. The security guard also looked high himself...so good luck feeling safe. Nothing was stolen from me like other reviews because I took *everything* with me when I'd leave. Also, the free coffee in the morning is a sham. Don't get there at 9:05 a.m. - there won't be any coffee left. They'll tell you "They're making more" and to "come back at 9:30" and when you come back, they tell you "there's no coffee left". A horrible stay..too many stoners and people who looked under 18 staying here. Find a better place in Hotel Circle next time.

Reviews.Title: “Average place, but constant people coming and going all through the night”
Reviews.Author: PoliticalTraveler
Reviews.Content: Average Motel 6 as far as the room went. My only issue was the constant people coming and going all through the night. You get less than what you pay for at this location, but there weren't many other options in this price category in this city.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: daveyinaz
Reviews.Content: First thing to remember...this is a motel 6. I think I read a review that it was in a scary neighborhood or something yet that person must have lived a sheltered life because there was no reason to fear for one's life in this area (except for maybe the 90mph traffic whizzing down the 8. This motel 6 is located in the Hotel Circle and has roughly the same type of parking as all the rest of the hotels in the area even though it was definitely exponentially cheaper than all the others. The hotel circle is in a good location I think, you barely have travel something like 5 miles to get to either old town san diego, sea world, downtown san diego, mission beach and all that. The only downside is the wireless internet. You have to purchase a card which gives you a password so you can log onto their network for 24 hours. The network connectivity was fine and the speed was adequate inside the room.

Reviews.Title: “Huge Room, Clean and good location!!!”
Reviews.Author: ryan2412
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel 6 for 3 nights at the end of august. Its so easy to get to it, literally right of the freeway. We checked in pretty quickly and were given an excellent map and directions from the reception staff. When we arrived at our 3rd floor room we were impressed, it was huge! There was plenty of space, and was twice the size of previous motel 6's ive stayed in! The motel is in a good location. Its minutes away from pacific beach, seaworld, and the mall etc. A little bit far out if your intending on spending alot of time in downtown, but still only a ten minute drive or so. Overall a good motel 6 with a brilliant location, and great value!

Reviews.Title: “It's a Motel 6....”
Reviews.Author: bdivalerio
Reviews.Content: It's a Motel 6.... pretty much enough said. I've stayed at a few Motel 6's but I try to stay away from them. From my experience this one wasn't too much different from the others. Front desk staff was slow and unfriendly... not surprising. Room was small and had an interesting smell to itâ€¦ part of Motel 6â€™s charm. An added bonus to this Motel 6 was the dead cockroaches in the hall and the wires hanging out of the wall in the room that was obviously where the smoke detector used to be located. My friends and I only stayed one night and we are all pretty much poor college students, so the few "problems" with the hotel didn't overshadow the savings. If you have the money then stay somewhere nicer. If you like paying $60 a night and can deal with a few deficiencies then stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Staff and Robbed”
Reviews.Author: flansy
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many a Motel 6, and I am aware that they are not the nicest places to stay, however they are always good for a roof over your head and place to stay, hopefully leaving some money left in your pocket for having a good time. Not this one. We arrived at around 10:30pm to find the lobby already locked up. Luckily there was a air condiftioned foyer to stand in. Unluckily, the automatic door wouldn't close and they just wasted electricity... One guest was in font of me and they had started to overcharge her for her room. She had papers saying that she had booked at a lower price and the staff person went to get the supervisor. There were three people in the office, and yet none of them would help me or the other guest who arrived a short time after me. Instead we had to stand, waiting for an hour while two staff people wandered around and the supervisor tried to puzzle out the correct rate. I don't blame the person who was going to be overcharged $50 a night for arguing. The prices of this Motel 6 were already higher than one in downtown, and this made no sense considering there was a big convention in town. Also, one could note from the posted rates, that they had raised the rates at this Motel for the convention weekend. After an hour, we finally were able to check into our room. We were not delighted to note that the TV, the vanity, and the desk were covered in a sticky substance, which I assume from the splatter marks were exploded soda. As we had been traveling for awhile, we just went to bed and thought to say something about it in the morning. Everyday we were there we said something about it, and it was never cleaned. The places was totally booked, so there was no switching rooms, and being this particular weekend there were no other rooms in town. So for three days we lived with someone's sticky exploded (I pray) soda. I had left my pocket change in an ash tray (in our non smoking room) and when I came back to the room it was gone. I figured that the maid had thought it was tip, and it was my mistake for leaving it out like that. Not going to quibble over two bucks in change, we said nothing, I wish we had said something, because the next day $30 worth of items that we had bought were stolen from our room. I have stayed in many a Motel 6 and in hotels which are actually far more rundown and seedier than this one, and yet I have NEVER been stolen from. Most of the time when I read revews where someone says they were stolen from, I think "why would the staff risk their job?" I am the kind of person who checks under the bed, and shakes out the sheets.. We were stolen from and I suppose I will start taking those reviews from people who said the same with a bit more faith now. The only positive note I do have on this place, was when the kids were drinking, smoking, and being loud right outside our room at 3am, the security answered our call and took care of it all within 5 minutes!

Reviews.Title: “Reservation Lost, Confirmation Number Useless”
Reviews.Author: cweg
Reviews.Content: Booked a room months in advance for a convention. Called ahead over 24 hours prior to arrival to cancel the first night, couldn't do it directly with the motel, had to talk to their national office. Person who was canceling first night, booked night before also instead, when I didn't arrive that night the other 4 nights were canceled. In speaking both with the establishment and the national office I was told there was nothing they could do, even though they could see where their employee had changed the reservation incorrectly. Be sure you have a written record of your reservation e-mailed to you so you don't find yourself without a room for 4 nights in July. When I asked to speak to the supervisors superior I was told she was the supervisor! Tom Bodeen should be ashamed! I ended up having to use Expedia to book 3 different rooms at 3 different establishments at a great expence to me.

Reviews.Title: “HUge Clean Room at an ok price”
Reviews.Author: jlh62464
Reviews.Content: Stayed here two nights while visiting San Diego. The room was absolutely huge, and it was very clean. No decorations on the wall, felt like I was sleeping in a large concrete box. But a very clean one! When I go on vacation, I don't go for the room. If I did want a vacation that was about the room, I'd stay close to home and visit a 5 star for a couple nights. I go on vacation to visit an area, and I get a room because unfortunately at some point I will need to stop what I'm doing to go sleep and shower. This room gave me what I needed. A clean place to sleep and shower. ...but a picture or two on the walls wouldn't hurt. Price was ok I guess. It was one of the lower priced in the Seaworld area. But I slept for alot cheaper at a similar hotel (a chain hotel but not a Motel 6) in Orange County on this vacation. I tried to book the same hotel chain in S.D that I did in the OC, but it was booked. It would have been less expensive. This Motel 6 is minutes from Seaworld (5?). About 15 mins from the beach. Center city San Diego is about 10 mins. I'd recommend this Motel 6, but I would also advise you to check a couple others before booking (look by the Sports Arena). Only because of price.

Reviews.Title: “Very Unhelpful People”
Reviews.Author: genapooh2
Reviews.Content: Myself and my sister, who is diabetic, stayed here for two nights in june, and it was not a pleasant experience. The motel itself was ok, room was ok, nothing great. But my sister being diabetic needed her freezer packs frozen nightly to keep her insulin cold while we were out in the heat all day long. Well first attempt for them to freeze it was useless, they managed to put it in a fridge, which wasn't good enough for day long trips. The next night, and another new guy at the front desk was "unable" to take it and freeze it either so we asked to keep the insulin in the fridge (which was bagged and labelled, because the mini fridge we brought with us gave out) and they said they could not garentee that it wouldnt get tampered with.... the only people who can acess this fridge is their employees. Thought that was a bit much. They were not accomidating at all so we cancelled our last night there.

Reviews.Title: “OK for one night”
Reviews.Author: disneyvisitor105
Reviews.Content: Our family of four stayed at this motel for one night, on the way to the San Diego Zoo. The location was good for our trip. The hotel staff was courteous, and they gave us the top floor in the room farthest from the traffic noise. We watched the fireworks at Sea World through our window. The room was very clean and quiet except for one incident, At about 2 am, someone pressed the elevator alarm button several times and woke all of us. Our room was very close to the elevator and so the bell was very loud. Other than that, the experience was mostly positive, although we were cautious of strangers in the hallway. We didn't spend a lot of time there and did not use the pool due to all the construction and safety concerns. The smaller building next to the Motel 6 sign is currently under construction, and the office is in a temporary trailer next to the front entrance. We dined at a Day's Inn Cafe that was a few miles away. Overall, it was OK for one night.

Reviews.Title: “Not my first choice”
Reviews.Author: sttmcdinmo
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a 3 day weekend in April 07....wasn't my first choice, but due to business convention in town, it worked. Didn't spend much time in room, thank goodness. They cleaned it everyday...new towels, etc...honest maids but had some people roaming the halls all hours of the day/night that worried me a bit. I go to San Diego about every 3 months, and I won't be returning here. I've never felt intimidated anywhere in SD, so this was a first. I'd definitely pick somewhere bay side, by the embarcadero area. I love this city, just not this area. I don't feel that hotel circle is a convienient area myself, unless you spend alot of time in Old Town, which has changed dramatically.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: arizonagal7
Reviews.Content: This motel met both of my criteria 1-Clean, 2-Inexpensive. It was easy to find... right off the interstate. If your just looking for a comfortable, quiet place to sleep, this is your motel. Added bonus: Friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “DIS-gusting!”
Reviews.Author: lizzard9
Reviews.Content: Filthy room! - our mattress had a huge stain going down the side of it that was either dried blood or coffee (let's hope the latter), and the entire room reeked of mildew or cat pee (let's hope the former). Loud obnoxious hoodlums hanging out on the walkways kept us up at night, and they were so intimidating we didn't dare confront them. Our room was on the top floor, but we took the stairs every time, as the elevator smelled awful and made frightening noises. We were less concerned about falling 4 floors than the prospect of getting trapped in such a dank space. There are many, many more properties on Hotel Circle Drive that DON'T advertise on Expedia. They seemed much better kept, and advertised rates comparable or less than what the Motel 6 charged (around $90). My advice is to do a little more research, and stay somewhere else nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Budget Conscious Travelers”
Reviews.Author: mlreyna111
Reviews.Content: I was skeptical of the motel when reading some of the reviews, but decided to give it a try and leave if I didn't like it. I traveled with my husband and 3 year old daughter June 3rd - 7th. This was a perfect room for us. It matched our budget and was a clean, spacious room. We stayed in room 410 (I recommed this one). We didn't hear anyone stomping on the floor because we were on the top floor. We did hear people in the hallway some evenings, but it was never late at night. The room was very spacious, we had two queen beds. I loved the separate tub/toilet room and the separate area with a sink on one side and a vanity mirror on the other side. The a/c worked perfect. The windows also opened to the outside. If I had to complain about something, I guess it would be that there was not an alarm clock or coffee maker in the room. Other than that, as long as you aren't expecting a luxury resort, this motel will do perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and decent”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Room was very clean -- everything looked new. It was a basic room -- no alarm clock or coffemaker, no sample shampoo. There was, however, free coffee available in the lobby in the morning. It was a decent place to spend the night, although we could hear the people in the upstairs room stomping around above us.

Reviews.Title: “Good for us”
Reviews.Author: happy_families_8
Reviews.Content: A good Motel 6; standard rooms with 2 queen size bed, ideal for family of 2 Adults + 2 kids; nice pool. Good location for visiting Sea World a few miles away. Nearest restauranr, Hunterd, very good but pricey; maybe better to order in pizza if you're on a budget. Would stay again. Note of warning to British visitors - San Diego starts the day overcast, so you forget to put on the sunscreen and wears hats before heading off the Sea World. Ouch ! Would recommend this hotel as a good budget hotel

Reviews.Title: “The front desk was incredibly rude!”
Reviews.Author: AustinMurphys
Reviews.Content: We requested a non-smoking room and we were put in a room thatt reeked of cigarettes. I felt like I was in an ashtray! We requested to be moved, and the folks at the front desk explained, in a very sharp tone that they could not move us as the room had been "disturbed". We demanded our money back, and the front desk refused. The room itself was very spartan, and I regretted the stay. I was happy I was only there for one night. I will never go back.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at this motel a couple times. It has a great location and is very reasonable pricewise for San Diego. There is a pool and we found the rooms were fine. We especially like the rooms toward the back of the motel which overlook the golf course and are away from the freeway. If you're looking for economy, this is the place.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: Gtpmax
Reviews.Content: The good points are that the room was cheap and the hotel is in a good location near the freeway. The bad points are that the room was well worn and had not been updated. The beds were falling apart, the carpet stained and the room had an unpleasant odor. I would recommend this hotel only to the budget conscious.

HotelInfo.Name: Motel 6 San Diego Hotel Circle
HotelInfo.Address: 2424 Hotel Circle N, I-8/Mission Valley Freeway West at Hotel Circle North, San Diego, CA 91942
